alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 8:28PM EST until January 19 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Kershaw, Fairfield and Lancaster Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 101.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue falling to 96.6 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 10 am Thursday.Thursday morning at 1000 AM EST.
